sourcesContent:
import React from "react"; import logo from "./images/logo.png"; import homeIcon from "./images/dashboardHome.svg"; import { useEffect } from "react"; //a hook that GIVES "side-effects" import { useHistory } from "react-router-dom"; // allows us to access our path / route history. import Axios from "axios"; //allows us to make GET and POST requests from the browser. import { useState } from "react"; //HERE we import useState Hook so we can add state to our functional components. import swal from 'sweetalert'; function Home() { let history = useHistory(); //USE HISTORY it will DETERMINED OUR PAST PATH. const [requested, setRequested] = useState([]); const [userDetails, setUserDetails] = useState([]); const isLoaded = [true]; useEffect(() => { if (isLoaded) { let format = (JSON.parse(localStorage.getItem("userDetails"))); setUserDetails(format) console.log(format) Axios.post( "http://localhost:5000/login", { email: localStorage.getItem("email"), password: localStorage.getItem("password"), } ) .then((response) => { console.log("User is validated"); /////GET THE INVESTMENT DATAS Axios.post( "http://localhost:5000/getFunds", { email: localStorage.getItem("email"), } ) .then((response) => { console.log(response.data.fund); setRequested(response.data.fund); }) .catch((error) => { console.log("Cant display the Investments Balance"); }); }) .catch((error) => { history.push("/login"); window.location.reload(); }); } else { console.log("ERROR"); } }, isLoaded); ///////////////SENDING FUND REQUEST const [type, setType] = useState(""); const [amount, setAmount] = useState(""); const Send = (e) => { Axios.post( "http://localhost:5000/sendFund", { action: e, type: type, amount: amount, date: new Date().toLocaleString(), email: localStorage.getItem("email"), } ) .then((res) => { swal({ title: "Fund successfully requested!", icon: "success", showConfirmButton: false, }); }) .catch((err) => { alert("ERROR"); }); }; function Logout(){ localStorage.clear() window.location.reload() } return (

Initial Investment



Start with a small amount to test An initial investment is the starting amount of money that it takes to either open an account or establish a buy-in relationship. The term “initial investment” is primarily used in two distinct but related sectors: banking and long term investment.
Transfer assets from Wallet




Fixed Investment



Choose a better plan depends on your ability to invest A type of investment that offers a profit percentage for a specified amount of time, with the principal repaid at maturity. Covers a broad range of investments, with varying degrees of risk, such as term deposits,government bonds, corporate bonds, stock market, debentures and brokerage deals.
Transfer assets from Wallet

Regular Investment



A RIP enables you to invest a set amount of money on a regular basis A regular investment plan allows you to choose when and how often you make contributions - ensuring that investing remains a priority throughout the year, and not just during RRSP season.
Transfer assets from Wallet
